New Records: Alex Hales scored 53 off 40, Harry Brook scored 42 off 25
Key Match Events: England's Alex Hales made his first mistake, but got an instant reprieve as the debutant spilled it
Pakistan's Babar Azam was bamboozled by an unplayable googly from Adil Rashid
Harry Brook carried his team across the finish line with four balls and six wickets to spare
Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan scored 68 off 46, but was undone by a stumping three balls later
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan to wear ‘special jersey’ in first England T20 to highlight flood devastation
Pakistan, England build for T20 World Cup in long-awaited series
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan were unable to celebrate England’s long-awaited return to the country with a victory
England won by six wickets, with Luke Wood being the player of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan's struggles against spin and their over reliance on the openers came to light once again
England's Alex Hales gave the visitors momentum in the powerplay despite losing fellow opener Phil Salt
The sub-par score eventually meant Pakistan were unable to celebrate England’s long-awaited return to the country with a victory
